newsitem.title: USA: Natgas futures rally further on late short cover.
newsitem.headline: Natgas futures rally further on late short cover.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures continued to score gains late Tuesday in moderate trade, with more short covering driving the soon-to-expire November contract through key resistance, industry sources said.
At 1405 EDT, November was up by 14.3 cents at $2.625 per million British thermal units, while December was 12.7 cents higher at $2.73. Others were up by 1.6 to 10.5 cents.

"It's a little cold in the Midwest, but (longer-term), I don't see that much bullish in the weather. This is not new buying and I think it's blowing out too early (in the season)," said one East Coast trader.
Traders said colder Midwest weather helped firm the cash and fuel buying last night on ACCESS that pushed the spot contract through minor resistance in the $2.51 area.
They said shorts, spooked after recent gains and facing increased spot margins later today, opted to bail ahead of November's expiration this Friday.
But some were skeptical, expecting mostly above-normal Eastern temperatures later this week and next to cap the rally.

Technically, with November off the board Friday, traders said a December settle above the recent $2.725 recent high could lead to a move to the $2.80 area and possibly a test of the $2.865 contract high.

Cash sources said Gulf Coast prices firmed about 10 cents Tuesday to near the $2.50 level. Midcon pipes were up 10 cents or more to about $2.40. New York city gate gas also gained about 10 cents to the low-$2.90s. November city gate quotes were in the NYMEX plus 65-cent area.
NYMEX said 34,700 Hub contracts traded at 1335 EDT.
NYMEX November Alberta natgas was still up by 3.5 cents at $1.11, while deferreds remained untraded at 1410 EDT. NYMEX said 28 Alberta contracts traded by 1335 EDT.
NYMEX November Alberta natgas expires Tuesday, October 29.
NYMEX November Permian natgas jumped 16.5 cents to $2.38, while deferred months were untraded.
NYMEX November Permian natgas expires Tuesday, October 29.
On the KCBT, November was 13 cents higher at $2.42, while deferreds were up by 7.5 to eight cents. The East/West spread widened by 1.3 cents to 20.5 cents (NYMEX premium).
KCBT November natgas expires Monday, October 28.
